title: God of my life, to thee I call

verses.text:
Yet why, dear Lord, this tender care?
Why doth thy hand so kindly spare
A useless cumberer of the ground,
On which so little fruit is found?

Still let the barren fig-tree stand,
Uphold and watered by thy hand;
Its fruit and verdure yet shall be
A grateful tribute, Lord, to thee.
